title: Add lightweight formatting/linting for the pipeline Python package
scope: Add lightweight formatting and linting for the pipeline Python package (focus: maintainability and consistency).
Prefer low-friction tooling (fast, deterministic) and avoid heavy refactors.
Do not reformat unrelated files unless required by the chosen tool and agreed by the project.
acceptance: A formatter/linter configuration exists for the pipeline package (e.g. ruff/black) with deterministic settings.
There is a documented command to run formatting/linting (script or npm target) suitable for CI.
`npm run guardrails` and existing workflows remain compatible.

deliverables.title: Pipeline lint/format configuration and runnable command
acceptance: A single command exists to run lint/format checks for the pipeline package.
evidence: Running the lint command produces deterministic output and non-zero exit on violations.

subtasks.title: Choose and configure lightweight lint/format tooling with deterministic settings.
done_when: Config exists under `pipeline/pyproject.toml` and is deterministic.
Tool runs quickly enough to be practical in CI.

subtasks.title: Add a repo command/script to run pipeline lint/format checks consistently.
done_when: A script exists at `scripts/lint/pipeline.sh` and is executable in CI.
The script returns non-zero exit codes on failures with actionable output.
